dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: People think international travel is all about the big legacy carriers, but actually, a new low-cost airline is shaking things up in Central Asia.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: People think international travel is all about the big legacy carriers, but actually, a new low-cost airline is shaking things up in Central Asia.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starting from June 1, 2025, a new international airline " Air Arabia Abu Dhabi, based in the United Arab Emirates, will begin operations in Kazakhstan. The company is known for its affordable pricing policy and a modern fleet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, right, Air Arabia Abu Dhabi is launching flights to Almaty starting June 1st, 2025. That's huge for that region.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, right, Air Arabia Abu Dhabi is launching flights to Almaty starting June first, twenty twenty five. That's huge for that region.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starting from June 1, 2025, a new international airline " Air Arabia Abu Dhabi, based in the United Arab Emirates, will begin operations in Kazakhstan. The airline plans to launch regular direct flights on the Abu Dhabi " Almaty route.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they're flying three times a week—Tuesdays, Fridays, Sundays—on Airbus A320s. First flight's actually June 3rd.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they're flying three times a week-Tuesdays, Fridays, Sundays-on Airbus A320s. First flight's actually June third.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Flights will operate three times a week " on Tuesdays, Fridays, and Sundays using Airbus A320 aircraft. The first flight is scheduled for June 3.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, that's pretty frequent for a new route. And they're offering free streaming with SkyTime, which is nice for a budget airline.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, that's pretty frequent for a new route. And they're offering free streaming with SkyTime, which is nice for a budget airline.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the flight, passengers will have access to free streaming content via the SkyTime service, as well as the option to purchase snacks and drinks from the SkyCafe onboard.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Totally, plus they have SkyCafe for snacks and drinks onboard. And the Air Rewards loyalty program lets you earn points, which is rare for low-cost carriers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally, plus they have SkyCafe for snacks and drinks onboard. And the Air Rewards loyalty program lets you earn points, which is rare for low-cost carriers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the flight, passengers will have access to free streaming content via the SkyTime service, as well as the option to purchase snacks and drinks from the SkyCafe onboard. Additionally, travelers can benefit from the Air Rewards loyalty program, which allows them to accumulate, spend, and transfer bonus points.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it's a joint venture between Air Arabia and Etihad Airways, so there's some major backing behind it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's a joint venture between Air Arabia and Etihad Airways, so there's some major backing behind it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is worth noting that Air Arabia Abu Dhabi is a joint venture between Air Arabia and Etihad Airways.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And with the visa-free agreement, Kazakh citizens can visit the UAE for up to 30 days without a visa—that's a big incentive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And with the visa-free agreement, Kazakh citizens can visit the U A E for up to thirty days without a visa-that's a big incentive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakh citizens can enter the UAE without a visa for up to 30 days, thanks to the visa-free agreement between the two countries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And this is part of a bigger push—Kazakhstan's government mentioned they're bringing in four new international low-cost airlines this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And this is part of a bigger push-Kazakhstan's government mentioned they're bringing in four new international low-cost airlines this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In February of this year, Deputy Minister of Transport Talgat Lastayev announced plans to launch flights from Kazakhstan with four new international low-cost airlines.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, like T'way from Korea, SpiceJet from India… and they expect 12 more aircraft by the end of 2025.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, like T'way from Korea, SpiceJet from India... and they expect twelve more aircraft by the end of twenty twenty five.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In early April, Chair of the Civil Aviation Committee Saltanat Tompieva clarified that these included the Korean carriers T'way and Eastar Jet, the Indian low-cost carrier SpiceJet, and Thailand's AirAsia X. According to her, 12 more aircraft are expected to arrive by the end of 2025.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which makes sense 'cause their national fleet just got four new planes this year already—two for Air Astana, two for Fly Arystan.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since the beginning of the year, the national fleet has already been expanded with four aircraft " two for Air Astana and two for Fly Arystan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So it's not just one new route; it's like a whole expansion strategy for Kazakh aviation and tourism.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it's not just one new route; it's like a whole expansion strategy for Kazakh aviation and tourism.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And having Abu Dhabi as a hub through Zayed International Airport? That connects Central Asia to so many other destinations.
